2001 I never imagined-even in my wildest dreams-that we would get as far, as fast as we have today," Mr. Eric Schmidt said in a post on the Official Google Inc. Blog. Search has quite literally changed people's lives-increasing the collective sum of the world's knowledge and revolutionizing advertising in the process. And our emerging businesses-display, Android, YouTube and Chrome-are on fire. Of course, like any successful organization we've had our fair share of good luck, but the entire team-now over 24,000 Googlers globally-deserves most of the credit. Google Inc. 's co-founders brought in Mr. Eric Schmidt , a trained computer scientist, to shepherd the young company along in the early days of the dot-com boom and eventually he helped take Google Inc. public in 2004. top of the company". Larry Page, who founded the company with Sergey Brin , will now run the company in the CEO role with Eric Schmidt moving to an "executive chairman" position. Larry will now lead product development and technology strategy, his greatest strengths, and starting from April 4 he will take charge of our day-to-day operations as Google's chief executive officer. In this new role I know he will merge Google's technology and business vision brilliantly , says Eric Schmidt before adding: "I am enormously proud of my last decade as CEO, and I am certain that the next 10 years under Larry will be even better! In Washington, Donald Rumsfeld was known as a tenacious and effective fighter of policy wars, once described by Henry Kissinger as a skilled full-time politician-bureaucrat in whom ambition, ability, and substance fuse seamlessly.
